sentence.text: Somewhat arbitrarily, three disorders were successively put forward as the underlying cause of HIES: autosomal dominant (AD) regulation of transcription, DNA-templated deficiency, the only disorder corresponding to the original definition of HIES, and autosomal recessive (AR) positive regulation of GTPase activity and UDP-N-acetylglucosamine biosynthetic process deficiencies, in which atopy and high serum IgE levels occur in a context of manifestations not seen in patients with typical HIES.
